availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1826. Merchant. Married to Elizabeth Goodrich Tinsley with two children, John E. Tinsley and Lou Ella Tinsley. Worked as a clerk in a Trimble County, Kentucky store from 1840 to 1849. Opened his own store as merchant, with the aid of Morris Thomas in 1850 at Eminence, Kentucky. Engaged in business with B. F. Guthrie in 1852. Member of the Democratic Party.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclop√¶dia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 784; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 144; "Judge Richard L. Tinsley," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=28414998&ref=acom) (accessed on April 17, 2017).
